info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 3:03PM PDT until July 25 at 5:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL CLARK COUNTY... At 303 PM PDT, The public and area gages reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported flooding on Lake Mead Parkway as well as on Las Vegas Blvd near the I-15 junction. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Western portions of Henderson, North Las Vegas, Lake Las Vegas, East Las Vegas, The Motor Speedway, Las Vegas Bay, Nellis AFB, Las Vegas Bay Campground, Lake Mead Parkway, Lake Mead Blvd, Las Vegas Blvd, Sunrise Mtn and Frenchman Mtn. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 48 and 59. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. If on land, campers and hikers should avoid washes and low-lying areas and seek higher ground. If on the water, put on a life jacket, make your way to a sheltered cove or inlet, and write down GPS coordinates in case a rescue is needed. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
